sentences: Joseph Dougherty "Joe" Carter (February 27, 1927 – March 2, 2005) was a member of the Carter Family, an American country/folk music group.
Carter was born in 1927 in Maces Spring, Virginia several months before the Bristol Sessions, which eventually made his family famous.
His father was Alvin Pleasant "A.P." Delaney Carter (1891–1960) and his mother was Sara Carter (1898–1979).
Joe Carter performed with the Carter family from 1939 to 1940 on Border Radio and with his sister Janette and his parents Sara and A.P. Carter from 1952 till 1956 on a program called Acme Sessions.
Carter served as a sailor during World War II and returned to Virginia after his service and worked in the construction industry.
